main event: Two unidentified aircraft were intercepted by the 6585th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron at Las Cruces Air Force Station, exhibiting erratic flight paths and speeds up to 1000 mph on 7 February 1957.
interesting points: The two objects were confirmed by two distinct radar systems at the Las Cruces Air Force Station,Visual confirmation was made by an Air Defense Direction Officer and a T-33 interceptor crew.,The aircraft exhibited flight characteristics beyond known capabilities, including rapid accelerations and decelerations.,Investigation ruled out natural radar phenomena as the cause of the sighting, as visibility was good at the time.,The conclusion of the investigation was that the targets were real, indicating advanced technology not known in contemporary aircraft.
witness description: Air Defense Direction Officer and T-33 interceptor crew
